intro: Caesalpinia gillettii, commonly known as the golden wattle, is a shrub or small tree native to Australia. It is characterized by its bright yellow, feathery inflorescences that bloom in spring and summer. The plant has bipinnate leaves, which are divided into small, thread-like leaflets. It produces pod-like fruits that contain several seeds, and it thrives in well-drained soils in full sun. Caesalpinia gillettii is an important species in Australian flora and is also the national floral emblem of Australia.
